pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:5.1: 65. The training rule on clasping the knees
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people who were seated clasping their knees. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:7.1: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone who is seated clasping his knees and who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:8.1: One should not give teachings to anyone who is seated clasping his knees and who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone who is clasping his knees with his hands or with a cloth and who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:10.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
